common.hotkeys.console.toggle.name: Toggle Accessibility Console
common.hotkeys.pause_resume.name: Pause / Resume
common.hotkeys.pause_resume.description: Show/Hide the Pause Menu which displays all Cards, Followers, Mana and Map.
common.hotkeys.take_screenshot.name: Take a Screenshot
common.hotkeys.take_screenshot.descripti: Capture the current screen and save it to file.
common.hotkeys.menu.codex.open_close.des: Show/Hide the Codex which explains all the keywords in the game and lists all Enemies, Cards and Followers that you can encounter.
common.hotkeys.menu.map.open_close.name: Show/Hide Map
common.hotkeys.menu.map.open_close.descr: Show/Hide the Map. Only applicable during an active crusade.
common.hotkeys.menu.active.close.name: Close Active Menu.
common.hotkeys.menu.active.close.descrip: Close the last opened Menu if possible.
common.hotkeys.player.hand.show_hide.des: Show/Hide your Hand panel when in Exploration or Battle.
common.hotkeys.player.units.show_hide.de: Show/Hide your Followers panel when in Exploration or Battle.
common.hotkeys.player.skills.show_hide.d: Show/Hide your Blessings panel when in Exploration or Battle.
common.hotkeys.market.abilities.open_clo: Open/Close the Market, on the Advanced Actions tab.
Open/Close the Market, on the Spells tab.
common.hotkeys.market.units.open_close.d: Open/Close the Market, on the Followers tab.
common.hotkeys.map.move.left.name: Map Move Left
common.hotkeys.map.move.left.description: Move the Map slightly to towards the Left when in Exploration or Pause/Map menu.
common.hotkeys.map.move.right.name: Map Move Right
common.hotkeys.map.move.right.descriptio: Move the Map slightly to towards the Right when in Exploration or Pause/Map menu.
common.hotkeys.map.move.up.name: Map Move Up
common.hotkeys.map.move.up.description: Move the Map slightly to towards the Top when in Exploration or Pause/Map menu.
common.hotkeys.map.move.down.name: Map Move Down
common.hotkeys.map.move.down.description: Move the Map slightly to towards the Bottom when in Exploration or Pause/Map menu.
game.name: Paladin's Oath
game.phase.exploration.commit.descriptio:
Apply changes and effects now. This is done automatically but in some cases you may want to trigger it manually:

Typically when <style="status">Refreshing</style> Followers that have been <style="status">Activated</style>, the only way to <style="status">Activate</style> them again is to <style="value">Commit</style> first which you can do by <style="status">Moving</style> or <style="status">Revealing</style> new information or clicking the <style="value">Commit</style> button.
game.phase.exploration.movement.name: Movement
game.phase.exploration.movement.descript: Use Cards, Followers and Blessings to generate enough <style="value">Movement</style> points to <style="status">move</style> and <style="status">explore</style> the map</style>.
game.phase.exploration.interaction.name: Interaction
game.phase.exploration.interaction.descr: Triggered when you start committing to an <style="value">Interaction</style> with the Location you are standing on. Once the interaction is completed, your turn will <style="status">end</style> automatically.
game.phase.exploration.end_of_turn.name: End of Turn
game.phase.exploration.end_of_turn.descr:
Triggered automatically at the end of an <style="value">Interaction</style> with the Location you are standing on, or <style="status">Battling</style> Enemies on the map. You can also end the round by clicking the button if you don't want to Interact or Battle this round.

<style="value">Tips:</style>  Don't forget that before ending your turn, you can still use effects for <style="status">Healing</style>, creating Mana Crystals or <style="status">Refreshing</style> Followers if you have any.
game.phase.exploration.end_of_turn.confi: Do you want to <style="status">End the turn</style>? You will go back to the Camp Fire where you can <style="status">Rest</style> and draw more Cards.
game.phase.exploration.end_of_turn.with_:
You still have <style="value">Healing</style>, <style="value">Leadership</style> or <style="value">Movement</style> points available.

If you end your turn now, you will forfeit those points.

Do you still want to <style="status">End the turn</style>?
game.phase.battle.after.description: The phase After the Battle. At this stage, Enemies that are still alive will force the player to Retreat from the battle location, except for Rampaging Enemies which are fought in the open. This phase is an opportunity to Heal and Refresh Followers, before going back to exploration. Any effect used at this stage can still be reversed until the player commits to the result of the battle which will trigger the end of the battle and commit all cards, mana and effects used and actually deal the wounds to the player's hand/deck and on followers.
game.phase.battle.after.name: After Battle
game.phase.battle.attack.description: The Attack Phase is the third phase of battle. It is an opportunity to defeat the remaining enemies using all kinds of attacks. Enemy Fortification no longer matter in this phase, so Fortified enemies can be targeted by any kind of attack, even non-Range attacks. Enemies not Defeated during this phase will force the player to Retreat from the battle location, taking more wounds as they retreat and remain at the location. This does not apply to Rampaging enemies that are fought in the open. Enemies can be grouped together during this phase: you can combine multiple effects and attacks to target a group of enemies. When grouping enemies, they will share their Resistances for the purpose of receiving damage.
game.phase.battle.attack.name: Attack
game.phase.battle.before.description: The phase Before the Battle starts. This is a good opportunity to apply Healing, Buffs and Debuffs to yourself, Followers or Enemies.
game.phase.battle.before.name: Before Battle
game.phase.battle.block.description: The Block phase is the second phase of battle. Enemies that are still alive after the Range Attack phase now strike the player. You need to Block any enemy attack Individually. Any unblocked attack will deal Damage. You can use a Follower to tank the damage (*except for Marked attacks)
game.phase.battle.block.name: Block
game.phase.battle.range.description: The Range Attack phase is the first phase of battle. It is an opportunity to take out any Enemy using: - Range attacks against Non Fortified enemies - Siege attacks against Non Double Fortified enemies. Other attacks cannot be used in this phase. Enemies that are Double Fortified cannot be targeted at this phase until their Fortification has been reduced. Enemies can be grouped together during this phase: You can combine multiple effects and attacks to target a group of enemies. When grouping enemies, they will share their Resistances and Fortifications for the purpose of receiving damage or the type of attack that can target them.
game.phase.battle.range.name: Range
game.phase.none.name: None
game.settings.restart.title: Game Restart Required
game.settings.restart.description:
Some settings changes can only be applied at the next restart.

<style="value">Exit Now?</style>
game.settings.graphics.fps.label: Target Frame Rate
game.settings.graphics.quality.label: Quality Level
game.settings.graphics.resolution.label: Resolution
game.settings.graphics.monitor.label: Monitor
game.settings.graphics.widescreen.label: Widescreen Scaling
game.settings.graphics.widescreen.toolti: When enabled, it will allow odd resolutions to render properly like extra wide screens. [Default = <style="value">OFF</style>]
game.settings.graphics.vsync.label: V-Sync
game.settings.graphics.vsync.tooltip:
Vertical Sync (V-Sync) specifies the number of screen refreshes the game allows to pass between frames.

If the default screen render rate is 60 FPS: at 50% the game will try to render at 30 FPS, 20 FPS at 33% and 15 FPS at 25%.

When V-Sync is enabled, <style="value">Target Frame Rate</style> will be <style="status">ignored</style>.
